name: Interviewer
line: Yeah. In all discussion, I know you've heard it, low kicks, calf kicks, low kicks, calf kicks. When you hear that, do you say, "Yeah, I executed perfectly", or do you say, "Why are people not giving me credit for everything else I did in that fight?".

name: McGregor
line: You're going to walk like a dog in that octagon on Saturday night.

name: Interviewer
line: I guess, lastly, for me, Dustin, this is obviously different. It was similar last time. It's getting kind of ugly again. Is this getting personal for you at this point?

name: McGregor
line: You're only a little b***h. Your wife is your husband. You're only a little b***h of a thing; a silly little hillbilly. Joe Lee's wife, Joe Lee's wife, Joe Lee's wife, you little b***h of a thing.

name: Interviewer
line: Thanks, Dustin. Conor, I want to ask you the same. Conor, throughout your career, when something has gone wrong, you've always evaluated spot on and made the corrections right afterwards. You really did point to those low kicks and said how dangerous those were. In the time since, have you seen other issues or other challenges that he presents to you, or is that really all that you need to address here?

name: McGregor
line: This is my bread and butter. This is what wakes me up in the morning with fire in my belly. Errors to correct, tactics to prepare for. I've had a great camp, a great focus on the opponent's details.

name: McGregor
line: What?

name: McGregor
line: Yeah. Shut your mouth, you little filly or I'm going to dance on your head.

name: Interviewer
line: Conor, it's clear that the gentlemanly Conor that was in Abu Dhabi is not here this time around. Dustin's admitted, at fight number one, you got in his head. As you're sitting there right now, do you feel that you've been able to get into his head or under his skin again?

name: McGregor
line: I'm going to go through his head, put holes in them, and take it off his shoulders. That's the goal here. He's done here. This is it for him. This is the end of the road. Even after that last fight, "Oh, I don't love this anymore. I don't love doing this." He knew what was coming. He knew the smacks he took. It's on, now. Saturday night, he's getting walked around that octagon like a dog and put to sleep.

name: Interviewer
line: Hey, Conor, just one last one for you. We think about all the things that you've accomplished in your career. Certainly, there's not a title on the line in this one, but what would a win in this trilogy series mean for you? What would this mean, as part of your legacy?

name: McGregor
line: It's beautiful. Another addition, another feather to the cap. It's what I love to do. I love to come in here, defy the odds, do the unthinkable, and put on a show.

name: Interviewer
line: Thank you, Conor. Dane, just one quick one for you. I know that you were teasing some big numbers and big trends and were excited about it. As we sit right here, what can you tell us about the status of this pay-per-view and where you expect it to end up?

name: Interviewer
line: Question for Conor. You walked out, you posed for the crowd. It seems like you pulled some of Dustin's hot sauce out and threw it at him. Why did you feel the need to pour out his hot sauce?

name: McGregor
line: It's garbage. Don't have that garbage up on my bleeding stage. Where's the proper 12, the real sauce, the real Irish hot sauce.

name: Interviewer
line: Dustin, it seems like you have something to say.

name: McGregor
line: Good one.

name: Interviewer
line: Another one for Conor. This is really the first time you've been in the same room with Dustin since Fight Island. Has seeing him in person now, after all the back and forth, on social media-.

name: McGregor
line: I think he looks rough, to be honest. It looks like the wait is getting to him. I can see it in his eyes. There's stress in his eyes, a lack of sleep. You can see it. It's coming for him on Saturday night and he knows it and I know it. I'm going to love doing it.

name: Interviewer
line: Dustin, same question. Is finally seeing Conor in person, after all the back and forth on social media, has it elicited any more emotions or is it still just business, as usual?

name: McGregor
line: I see a corpse. I see a dead body.

name: McGregor
line: Question 3:.

name: McGregor
line: This is a question for Conor. This is a question for Conor. This ocho cinco with B/R Betting. A quick question, myself and the entire B/R Betting family, we're walking with you Saturday night. I want to hear from your mouth, are you a lock?

name: McGregor
line: I'm a lock. I'm going to kill this man.

name: Interviewer
line: All right. Robbie, Barstool Sports, over here. Question for Conor. Conor, we know you left the kids at home this time. Are they going to be watching on Saturday night or are they not allowed to witness the violence you plan on delivering?

name: McGregor
line: The fight will be about 5:00 in the morning on Irish time, so the kids will be asleep. They'll watch it in the morning, when they wake.

name: Interviewer
line: Conor, when people think about you, they think about the guy who apologized to absolutely nobody. Is that guy here today and will he be here on Saturday?

name: McGregor
line: An evolution of that guy. I'm better than that man, do you know what I mean? I'm out there evolving. I'm about to come on full circle and I look forward to showing it on Saturday night.

name: Interviewer
line: Dustin-.

name: McGregor
line: That night was the single greatest performance in UFC history, widely regarded. The night I won the second world title in Madison Square Garden. This performance, on Saturday night, I'm going to top it.

name: Interviewer
line: Question for the notorious Conor McGregor. You're already a hall of famer, your legacy is already cemented. Winning against Dustin Poirier, winning this trilogy fight, where does it stack up against all the accomplishment, beating Aldo, getting the Champ status against Eddie Alvarez. Where would this rank?

name: McGregor
line: My mindset, I'm back on the building site now with a hard hat, a  vest with two hammers on my fucking hands.

name: Interviewer
line: Out of curiosity, did you finish the bottle of hot sauce that Dustin gifted you on Fight Island?

name: McGregor
line: Didn't touch it.

name: Interviewer
line: Dustin, question for you. Winning this trilogy, would it be more meaningful than winning the interim lightweight strap at UFC 236 against Max Holloway?

name: McGregor
line: Don't contradict yourself, Dustin, because the last time we were up here, you were giving us all a large one. Saying, oh, the title means everything. Yet here you are looking for the bread and the butter, you little fake c***.

name: Interviewer
line: Then, this is the last question for both of you. Get your hand raised Saturday evening, how quickly would you like to return? Would you like to fight for the strap before the end of 2021 against ?

name: McGregor
line: Yes, we're going to fill out the Allegiance Stadium, the Death Star.

name: Interviewer
line: Question for Conor. Conor, the say that game recognizes game. When you look at Dustin, does he feel like he's on your level? Do you recognize him as a champ?

name: McGregor
line: No, he's not in the same stratosphere as me. The man looks disgraceful up here. He looks frail. He looks frail at this weight now. I'm telling you, his head, his body, his frame, his eyes. That weight class is getting to him. I'm all the way, ready to go. There'll be no 155, there'll be nothing free given here. Everything is getting took here.

name: Interviewer
line: Second question for Dustin. You entered the UFC as a young fighter. Now you're a wise business man. What's that journey been like for you to be entering the fight game, but now in the business game?

name: McGregor
line: Your wife is your husband.

name: Interviewer
line: Question for Conor. Conor, win or lose, do you respect Dustin Poirier no matter what happens on Saturday night?

name: McGregor
line: I don't give a fuck about him, to be honest. I don't give a rat's ass about him. He's Buster Douglas. He's Buster Douglas, is what he is and that's the way he's going to go down. He's going to be known for that. It was a fluke win and I'm going to correct it on Saturday night.

name: Interviewer
line: Does this Conor McGregor look-.

name: McGregor
line: He's not going to do nothing.

name: Interviewer
line: -that I can't pay attention to this fight.

name: McGregor
line: Don't keep watch on me, because that little filly won't do nothing.

name: Interviewer
line: Conor, right here. Conor, right down here. Conor, question for you. You have won exactly one fight since Barack Obama was president.

name: McGregor
line: Watch your mouth. I'll go down and smash your nose in.

name: Interviewer
line: Hold on. Conor, as a fighter-.

name: McGregor
line: I'll go smash your nose in and then I'll laugh. Then, I'll laugh.

name: Interviewer
line: Cross talks over the last six months.

name: McGregor
line: You little rabbit. I'll smack him.

name: Interviewer
line: Sent you to a place where time doesn't exist six months ago. We want to know why should anyone expect anything different on Saturday?

name: McGregor
line: It's one more fight I won than your little sissy ass, you little fanny pad.

name: Interviewer
line: Question for Conor. Despite your feelings towards Dustin, Habib, and Nate, do you still think it's important to have a strong rival to help you get better and establish legacy?

name: McGregor
line: Yeah. Fuck the whole roster. Fuck the entire roster. I see the way it is. You try and be nice to them, you try and help them out, but fuck them all now. It is what it is and that's it. I'm coming for all of them.

name: Interviewer
line: Question for Conor. I'm curious. You've been talking a lot about legacy. How much would a trilogy fight with Nate Diaz interest you?

name: McGregor
line: It's for sure going to happen. It must happen. More than that, it must happen, it will happen. I look forward to the day.

name: Interviewer
line: Last thing from me for Conor.

name: McGregor
line: Louisiana wasn't good enough for you, was it? You left Louisiana. It wasn't up to scratch to get you to where you needed to be, was it?

name: Interviewer
line: For Conor, what else do you feel you still have to accomplish? You already were a simultaneous two division title champ. What else do you have on your radar to accomplish?

name: McGregor
line: Strainers, scraps, fights. That's what I love to do. It's what I've been doing my entire life and that's it. More mega fights.

name: McGregor
line: Shut your mouth.

name: McGregor
line: What? Nobody's coming on, you tit. Pauli Malignaggi inspiring in the lead up to Floyd, one of the better boxers on this fucking planet, you stupid tosspot. We didn't ring anyone's ass for any bleeding info on you, you dope.

name: Interviewer
line: Question for Conor. Conor, the lack of trash talk last time around made things easier for Dustin, he said. Can you regain, in an intimidation factor, after losing it? How do you regain a psychological edge?

name: McGregor
line: I don't give a bollocks about all that. Lock me in the cage with him. You're going to see what's happening.

name: Interviewer
line: TMZ Sports. Conor, congrats on making the cover of Forbes.

name: McGregor
line: Thank you so much.

name: Interviewer
line: How long until you're a billionaire?

name: McGregor
line: By the time I'm 35. I'm 32 now.

name: Interviewer
line: 35. Okay. You'll be 33 next week. Do you want the boss, Dana, to get you anything for your birthday?

name: McGregor
line: No, I have everything I need. I have everything I need.

name: Interviewer
line: Thank you. Thank you. Conor, same question to you?

name: McGregor
line: I love it all. There's not one bit of it I hate. I love every bit of it, from the start, to the middle, to the finish, to gearing up, to right now, here at the presser, to the weigh in tomorrow, and to the fight on Saturday night. I absolutely love it all.

name: Interviewer
line: Conor, history has shown when you are active, you are sharper. Do you think you'll look back on this five year stretch and regret only fighting three times in your prime?

name: McGregor
line: I don't regret nothing I've done on this planet, as long as I live. I love my life. I've done some incredible things and I've had an incredible career. Long may it continue.

name: Interviewer
line: Conor, should we expect to check calf kicks this fight?

name: McGregor
line: You'll pay to see that.

name: Interviewer
line: Finally, Conor, I've watched all your interviews this week. It seems like you've been hesitant to give the official "Mystic Mac" prediction for this one. Can you go on record-.

name: McGregor
line: No, I said I'm going to take him out in a stretcher. He's going out in a stretcher in this fight.

name: Interviewer
line: What round, sir?

name: McGregor
line: You'll pay to see that.

name: Interviewer
line: Thank you.
